Package moulton.scalable.visuals

Class AnimatedView

java.lang.Object
moulton.scalable.utils.MenuComponent
moulton.scalable.visuals.AnimatedView
public class AnimatedView
extends MenuComponent
A menu component designed to display an Animation. The component can either keep the ratio of width to height for the animation or stretch to fill the space. This is determined by maintainAspectRatio.
Author:
Matthew Moulton

  • Field Summary

    Fields
    Modifier and Type Field Description
    protected Animation animation
    The image that will be drawn onto the coordinates provided.
    protected java.lang.String height
    The expression dimensions of the component
    protected boolean maintainAspectRatio
    Whether or not the view should draw the image in the same ratio as given or should stretch it to fill the area of the view.
    protected boolean outline
    Whether or not this component should render a black outline on the border of the component.
    protected java.lang.String width
    The expression dimensions of the component

    Fields inherited from class moulton.scalable.utils.MenuComponent

    DEFAULT_ORIGINAL_TEXT_SIZE, gridPoint, parent, text_resize_factor, visible, x, y

  • Constructor Details

    • AnimatedView

      public AnimatedView​(Animation animation, Panel parent, java.lang.String x, java.lang.String y, java.lang.String w, java.lang.String h)
      Parameters:
      animation - The animation that will be drawn onto the coordinates provided
      parent - the panel that this view will reside upon
      x - the x coordinate on the parent, given in menu component value format
      y - the y coordinate on the parent, given in menu component value format
      w - the width of the component, given in menu component value format
      h - the height of the component, given in menu component value format

    • AnimatedView

      public AnimatedView​(Animation animation, Panel parent, int x, int y)
      Parameters:
      animation - The animation that will be drawn onto the coordinates provided
      parent - the panel that this view will reside upon
      x - the integer x coordinate this button should appear on its panel
      y - the integer y coordinate this button should appear on its panel

  • Method Details

    • render

      public void render​(java.awt.Graphics g, int xx, int yy, int ww, int hh)
      Description copied from class: MenuComponent
      Draws on the graphics object to represent this component visually. When this method is called, the type of panel storing (grid or free) has been taken into account and the dimensions of the space given to this component have been calculated using MenuComponent.solveString(String, int, int).
      Specified by:
      render in class MenuComponent
      Parameters:
      g - the graphics object to draw on
      xx - the x-position on the graphics image that this component's alloted space begins
      yy - the y-position on the graphics image that this component's alloted space begins
      ww - the width on the graphics image that this component is given
      hh - the height on the graphics image this component is given

    • setAnimation

      public void setAnimation​(Animation animation)
      Sets the Animation that this view will draw when rendered.
      Parameters:
      animation - animation.

    • getAnimation

      public Animation getAnimation()
      Gets the animation to be drawn. By default this method returns animation.
      Returns:
      animation

    • setMaintainAspectRatio

      public void setMaintainAspectRatio​(boolean mar)
      Sets whether this view should keep the aspect ratio of the Animation that it displays.
      Parameters:
      mar - sets the value of maintainAspectRatio

    • isMaintainAspectRatio

      public boolean isMaintainAspectRatio()
      Returns whether this view will keep the aspect ratio of the Animation it displays.
      Returns:
      the value of maintainAspectRatio

    • setOutline

      public void setOutline​(boolean outline)

      Parameters:
      outline - outline

    • getOutline

      public boolean getOutline()
      Returns whether or not the clickable is displaying a black outline on its border
      Returns:
